In a three-dimensional environment with an XYZ coordinate system, there are two groups of agents: Defenders and Intruders, with each group containing 10 agents. The positions of the Defenders are represented as a (10, 3) matrix: [[1.8771734771064867, 2.9235244737629444, 0.5194265239629677], [0.7367880047944282, 1.1474793300999155, 3.1101061797875977], [1.1147137651643755, 1.736063828646149, 3.79305077172417], [0.07594909040401536, 0.11828370007572703, 0.7804475392702637], [2.089552767659228, 3.2542856214265115, 3.387517983899654], [0.06873255360222695, 0.10704460991536537, 0.12544197790816544], [0.5784678080547861, 0.9009102327287131, 3.6520718300780977], [0.8657379405800287, 1.3483069561861634, 0.5516515971088848], [1.8042842546398425, 2.810006235649303, 3.6478532033478], [0.3344656043861239, 0.5208993159023199, 0.8270172921454256]].  The Intruders' positions are also in a (10, 3) matrix: [[-1.818817817569365, -1.4413917270189331, 0.0], [-0.6916353019634377, 0.07164019094758788, 0.0], [-4.967368142958153, -1.3732311283335128, 0.0], [-3.6155045544511712, -0.1836635632483707, 0.0], [-4.500760384932397, -3.1852118958073268, 0.0], [-3.446753713131527, -0.457581746119771, 0.0], [-5.538219722970499, -1.9076119560181874, 0.0], [-2.663450064905594, -1.7820707475787376, 0.0], [-0.8298298956332999, -0.10113316816382267, 0.0], [-2.7216143336808085, -1.4218926236312033, 0.0]]. The objective is to pair each Defender with an Intruder in such a way that the total Euclidean distance between each pair is minimized.
